alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Logan; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:12PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, Wallace County in west central Kansas, southeastern Cheyenne and western Thomas Counties in northwestern Kansas, northwestern Logan County in west central Kansas, southwestern Rawlins and Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 1045 PM MDT/1145 PM CDT/... At 1011 PM MDT/1111 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Bird City to 9 miles north of Wallace to 7 miles southwest of Weskan. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Weskan around 1020 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 7 and 45. Highway 385 between mile markers 141 and 143. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding and reduced visibility. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways and use caution if driving in heavy rainfall.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne; Logan; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace
